results.title: Sunfruit
results.creator_credit: Jackson Wain and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Records a visit by a school group to a pineapple farm in Queensland. Shows the harvesting and processing of pineapples, and provides information about the planting and development of the fruit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Sunflowers
results.brief_description: An experimental film which admirably exploits the photogenic qualities of sunflowers. After a poetic opening a rapid montage of images links the flowers with the processes of birth, life and death,

results.title: Sunflowers
results.brief_description: At the Manitoba Experimental Farm, Julian Biggs interviews the plant breeder who is experimenting with sunflowers adapted to grow in prairie conditions.

results.title: Sundaze
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and Michael D. Carter
results.brief_description: A simple animated film of Anne Graham’s line drawings of a sunny day at the beach. Illustrates the variety of occupations people follow on the beach, and implies that a summer day by the sea is one of the best ways of enjoying life. Dis-orienting use of sound lends further interest to this unconventional sociological survey.

results.title: Sunday lark
results.creator_credit: Pathe Contemporary Films and Sanford Semel
results.brief_description: A lighthearted satire about the computers and gadgets of big business. When a small Chinese-American girl wanders into a modern office building on a Sunday her innocent delight in pressing buttons and using the gadgets creates such chaos that the guard calls for police reinforcements. As they arrive the little girl slips out of the building unnoticed.

results.title: Sunday father
results.creator_credit: International Productions, Films Incorporated, Sheldon Satin and Paul Leaf
results.brief_description: Shows the contemporary situation of a divorced man who takes his daughter on a once-a-week outing on Sunday afternoon. Focuses on the problem of a father trying to be friends with a little girl whom he sometimes feels barely knows him. Featuring Dustin Hoffman and Jane Schisgal with music and vocals by Janis Ian.

results.title: Sunday by the sea
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Harlequin Productions and Anthony Simmons
results.brief_description: Watching a typical day at the Brighton seaside, we see how the Londoner enjoys himself on one of his favourite excursions. Ballads made famous in music halls take the place of commentary. Photography by Walter Lassally. (Awards: Grand Prix, Venice)

results.title: Sunday
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Chris Backhouse
results.brief_description: A clay animated short film where two gentlemen transform their lounge room into a ballet stage. While one plays the harp, the other one dons a tutu and dances to Beethoven’s “Fur Elise”. This simple Australian short is delightful and mischievous.
